Title: The House of Rothschild
Cast: George Arliss, Boris Karloff, Loretta Young, Robert Young, C. Aubrey Smith, Arthur Byron, Helen Westley, Reginald Owen, Florence Arliss, Alan Mowbray, Holmes Herbert, Paul Harvey, Ivan F. Simpson, Noel Madison, Murray Kinnell
Plot: The wealthy Rothschild family undergoes prejudice from the anti-Semitic society they live within. The story of the rise of the Rothschild financial empire founded by Mayer Rothschild and continued by his five sons. From humble beginnings the business grows and helps to finance the war against Napoleon, but it's not always easy, especially because of the prejudices against Jews. Written by Col Needham <col@imdb.com>
Keywords: rothschild, jew, napoleon, black and white segues into color, color sequence
Actors: George Arliss, Boris Karloff, Loretta Young
Director: Alfred L. Werker (as Alfred Werker), Sidney Lanfield (uncredited)
Writer: Nunnally Johnson (screen play), George Hembert Westley (based on a play by)
Description: Directed by Alfred L. Werker, Sidney Lanfield.  With George Arliss, Boris Karloff, Loretta Young, Robert Young. The wealthy Rothschild family undergoes prejudice from the anti-Semitic society they live within.
